episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of quirky and fascinating facts, including historical cheating methods in Chinese exams, Jack White's unique music release method, the development of GPS by Gladys West, and the influence of ice hockey on American accents. The hosts delve into these topics with humor and curiosity, exploring the unexpected connections and stories behind each fact.

facts.fact: Chinese students in the 1700s could rent underwear with test answers on it to smuggle into exam halls.
In 2004, musician Jack White released a single through the medium of a couch.
The mathematician who developed GPS didn't make it to the job interview where she'd later developed GPS because she couldn't work out the directions to get there.
Playing ice hockey can make you talk in a Canadian accent.
